parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command
</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.54

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Stamina System

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Set units' stamina (seconds until depletion)

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''setStamina''' stamina

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> stamina: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> Nothing

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[setStamina]] 42;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setStaminaScheme]], [[getStamina]], [[enableStamina]], [[setFatigue]], [[getFatigue]], [[Arma 3 Stamina]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 30, 2015 - 01:50 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Molaron|Molaron]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
"setStamina" has the same effect as "setFatigue".
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on December 26, 2018 - 11:34 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:demellion|demellion]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Note that [[setStamina]] will not be able to exceed a 100% stamina value given by the engine. It will minimize to a maximum possible value, similar to application of the old command [[setFatigue]] in a range of '''0..1'''. Example:
<code>[[getStamina]] [[player]]; // 8.58
[[getFatigue]] [[player]]; // 0
[[player]] [[setStamina]] 50; // This will be minimized to 8.58 on next unit simulation cycle. 
</code>
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
